text: They found this guy in Maine
who had been living completely alone in the woods for 30 years.
They called him the last true hermit.
Thirty years without the warmth of human touch,
without conversation.
The hermit felt more lonely when he was out in the world...
Alex! Alex!
Than he ever felt in the woods by himself.
Surrounded by people but drowning in solitude.
That kind of loneliness
can swallow you whole.
Hi. I texted you.
Yeah, I saw that. I was busy.
Well, Cristina would've responded. That's not how it works.
Not if she was doing what I was doing.
You pause. That's the rule.
What? If the text is urgent,
Cristina would say to Owen, "Pause,"
and I would say to Derek, "Pause,"
then we'd text each other back.
In the middle of sex? If the text is urgent.
The fact you are checking your text
while you're doing it is already sad.
We have a special ringtone. Hey, you want a special ringtone?
No. Wait, this pause thing...
Like, your legs are in the air and you're screaming and...
Pause. No, I don't pause. Jo doesn't pause.
She fast-forwards, she rewinds,
but she doesn't pause. Okay, that's gross.
Do you wanna scrub in on my IVC sarcoma?
Is it a kid? No.
Then no. Why?
Because I want some company.
Get a resident.
I have a resident. I want a grownup.
Bye.
Cristina would've scrubbed in. You're no good at this...
Bailey!

Well, you don't need me for that. Don't you have a resident?

Come on. It's gonna be good.
It's all over the liver, hepatic vein.
It's gonna be bloody and gross.
Does look like fun.

What's the surgical plan?

resect the tumor, and then replace with a graft.

I don't foresee any problems.
Could I ask you to...

What is it?
She wants you to swear on the book.
The Odyssey.

The day we met.
Michael's a rare book vendor.
Our hands touched when I was ringing her up,
and it was such a high.
It was electric.
We were both too shy to ask for a date.
So I wrote my number on a bookmark.
I saw it as soon as I got home, and then I called.
We've been together ever since.
This book, it's our wedding ring.

Sure. I swear.

They're weirdos.

if the osteogenesis imperfecta is type II or III?

I mean, there's surgeries and challenges, but we're surgeons.
We can handle challenges, right?
Mmm-hmm. I mean, we'll...

Dr. Herman is the big gun.
We only fire the big gun when we need the big gun.
I'm the little gun. So let the little gun work.

with the thinnest cross sections I can get.

All right? And before that, it's even worse.

Okay, what do you wanna do?
That's what I'm saying. I think we should decide.
No, no. I'm asking what you want.

Don't... Right now. What do you wanna do?

You're thinking of extending the incision?

Yes, Doctor.
See, the tumor should be in the suprahepatic IVC only.

It doesn't show any further local invasion.
Show me the coronal view?
What's the tumor doing all the way over there?
That's what I want to know.
- How old are these scans? - They're only two weeks old.
And they're completely outdated.
I mean, this thing is growing too fast.
Nothing is where it's supposed to be.
Tumor has extended to the IVC tributaries.
Yeah, these scans are useless.
I can't see what I'm doing.
Oh, God. It's also spreading through the diaphragm. Suction.
I can't even see where...
Neither can I.
Don't touch that. It's tearing.
The tumor's extended all the way up between the lungs.
Someone page cardio! It's all the way up into the pericardium.
Get the suction out. Don't touch it. Don't do anything.
Okay, page cardio, 911!
We gotta get out. Everybody out. Hands off.
What are we doing? What's going on?

diaphragm, pericardium, and maybe even her heart.
How can one tumor grow this big this fast?
It is everywhere. It's a monster.
So what do we do?
I have no idea.

and it's now reaching around her heart.
So Dr. Pierce is here.
Her heart?
It's entangled through the vein that stretches up

And it's growing more rapidly than anticipated.

Now there's all of you.
Three doctors.
Three is a lot.

Well, we're the Phaeacians.
You want all the Phaeacians you can get.
We are going to figure this tumor out.
Oh!
Mmm! So light. And it's last year's model.
We're weeks away from unveiling one
that will weigh 30% less.
Wow. Very impressive.
Your project is impressive.
Robotic limbs for injured vets? Sexy as hell.

Good. I want it to be.

so, please, call me if you need anything.
Thank you. Thank you for coming in.

I think you should definitely go for it. Really?
'Cause I was not that impressed with these transducers.

I'm talking about her.
Her vibes? You didn't feel her vibes?

You read that totally wrong.
Oh, please.
"Your project's sexy as hell.
"Ooh! Ooh, let's climb into bed."
I was actually uncomfortable.

There you are. Where have you been?
I was performing a CVS on April Kepner.

You know, the parents are right there.
And you talk to them, and then their kid is right there,
so they can hold them close and hope for the best.
The cat's on the roof.
With this, there's no kid to hold.
The problem feels so theoretical.
You know, there's no cat, there's no roof.
There's just two scared parents feeling totally helpless.
And you've had the results rushed?
Yeah. I should get them in, like, 24 hours.
Then there's nothing more to do about it today, which is good.

I have found us the most incredible surgeries,

Your crash course.

And you'll get to fix them all? We will.
Start reading.
You can thank me later.
And then, and this sounds crazy, I know, so don't even...
I'll build in a distribution of a radioactive seed during surgery,
keeping Dr. Herman's tumor bed free of recurring cells.
I thought you were gonna use a laser.

Try and keep up.
I'm sorry, Shepherd, but this is a great opportunity
for them to learn. I know. It's fine.
The laser is for ablating cells off the optic nerve.
It's a massive butterfly glioma.
Well, it's not just massive.
I mean, it's magnificent.

I will begin with a bifrontal approach.

any amount of time that he lives...
